title: Technology Integration Checklist Development: Self-Directed Expression and Reading Comprehension Competency Enhancement Design for Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool usage experience and intermediate proficiency in language learning (understanding grammatical structures, basic writing skills, conversational fluency at a daily communication level)
context.additional_context: Focuses on strengthening the ability to select and utilize technology integration tools for language education in smartphone-centric, resource-limited environments. Particularly emphasizes tool applications aimed at improving learners' expressive abilities and reading comprehension.

learning_goals: Learners analyze functional requirements (hardware/software) and budget ranges of various technological tools to select those aligned with language learning objectives (e.g., vocabulary expansion, grammar practice, pronunciation correction).

Using a technology integration checklist, learners design a process to comprehensively evaluate language education needs of learners, teachers, and institutions (e.g., writing feedback, speaking assessment, reading support).

Over a 1–6 month long-term course, learners establish detailed implementation plans (3+ phases) applying two or more tech tools (Quizlet, Google Classroom, etc.) to real language education scenarios (e.g., classroom role-play, virtual language exchange) through three project-based assessments. They achieve "Excellent" in four or more of five rubric items (fluency, accuracy, interaction, creativity, tech utilization).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
